intro: Vaccinium winitii, commonly known as the Chinese blueberry or the dwarf blueberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, dark blue or black berries that are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Vaccinium winitii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of fruit in its native habitat.
